trans-unit.note: Used on the login page, along with Password, as part of the user E1 credentials.
Used on the login page, along with User Name, as part of the user E1 credentials
Generally a hidden field only shown to admin or developers. The E1 environment, such as "PD910".
Generally a hidden field only shown to admin or developers. The E1 user role, such as "*ALL".
Generally a hidden field only shown to admin or developers. The web address where the jas server is located.
The text placed on the Login button when pressed will use the users credentials to attempt to login to E1

No maxwidth. Header text shown on the form prior to the login form, which is only shown if the user has not entered their login URL in the app Preferences, it was entered incorrectly, or the server is unavailable. A field will be shown where they can view and enter the Preferences URL
An acknowledgement of the presented information
An error shown on the login form when the user login failed

trans-unit.source: Server Connection Error: The application cannot connect to the server
trans-unit.note: No max width. An error shown when the app cannot connect to the server but the reason is unknown

trans-unit.source: Contact Administrator: The url is not registered in the jas.ini of the JAS server
trans-unit.note: No max width. An error shown when the app cannot connect because the URL is not registered, the user cannot correct this

trans-unit.source: Authentication Error: User and password are required fields
trans-unit.note: No max width. User and password cannot be blank

trans-unit.source: The server is unable to process the request.
trans-unit.note: No max width. Error shown on the screen when the request to the server failed

trans-unit.source: Your session is no longer valid. Please login again.
trans-unit.note: No max width. Error shown on the screen when the session has timed out
No max width. Text requesting the user to enter a configuration url on the first time they run the application.

trans-unit.source: The application cannot connect to the server. Verify that you have a working network connection and that the server URL is correct in the application preferences.
trans-unit.note: No max width. Text shown if the application is unable to connect to the server. A field (not editable) will be shown with the url that is configured.
Logout button will terminate the users session and then allow them to login again.

trans-unit.source: Contact Administrator: You are not authorized to run this application.
trans-unit.note: No max width. The user is not authorized in E1 to run this application.
A button on the page that returns the user to where they came from
Text for the link to view the application legal terms.
Done viewing the page
The name of the application shown on the about page.
The version of the application displayed on the about page.
The AIS server currently configured for the application shown on the about page.
The title of the about page.
User name shown on about page
Version of the JDE Application used for processing options
Mobile applicaiton id shown in about page
Html server displayed on about page
Mobile app version displayed on about page
AIS Server version displayed on about page
General tab on about page
Advanced tab on about page
Shown on about page when AIS server version is unknown
Text next to a check box to indicate if application is participating in Single Sign On (SSO)
